kuusisto.tinysound.internal

Interface SoundReference


  • public interface SoundReference
    The SoundReference interface is the Mixer's interface to the audio data of a Sound object. SoundReference is an internal interface of the TinySound system and should be of no real concern to the average user of TinySound.
    Author:
    Finn Kuusisto

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long bytesAvailable()
      Get the number of bytes remaining for each channel.
      void dispose()
      Does any cleanup necessary to dispose of resources in use by this SoundReference.
      double getPan()
      Gets the pan of this SoundReference.
      int getSoundID()
      Get the ID of the Sound that produced this SoundReference.
      double getVolume()
      Gets the volume of this SoundReference.
      void nextTwoBytes(int[] data, boolean bigEndian)
      Get the next two bytes from the sound data in the specified endianness.
      void skipBytes(long num)
      Skip a specified number of bytes of the audio data.

    • Method Detail

      • getSoundID

        int getSoundID()
        Get the ID of the Sound that produced this SoundReference.
        Returns:
        the ID of this SoundReference's parent Sound

        Gets the volume of this SoundReference.

        long bytesAvailable()
        Get the number of bytes remaining for each channel.
        Returns:
        number of bytes remaining for each channel

      • skipBytes

        void skipBytes(long num)
        Skip a specified number of bytes of the audio data.
        Parameters:
        num - number of bytes to skip

      • nextTwoBytes

        void nextTwoBytes(int[] data,
                boolean bigEndian)
        Get the next two bytes from the sound data in the specified endianness.
        Parameters:
        data - length-2 array to write in next two bytes from each channel
        bigEndian - true if the bytes should be read big-endian

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Does any cleanup necessary to dispose of resources in use by this SoundReference.
